result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:08 PM Prosecuting attorney John Harrison Sacia appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William Curtis Perry appeared by video, in custody from the Houston County Jail on behalf of Winona County.  Attorney Joseph Geraldson appeared by video for William Curtis Perry.  Hearing was scheduled as WPH. Defendant wishes to have preliminary hearing. Has a hearing tomorrow with Winona County, will know more of what is going to happen after that hearing. Defense advised TCSO has defendant's phone, wishing to have phone returned. State advised phone was seized as part of investigation, objects to release due to being part of the investigation. Defense requests any warrant by July 7th if it is to stay in sheriff's custody. Court reviews statute. Court advised motion needs to be filed and procedure to be followed. PH set. Bond cont.
